thread.title: The Left is evolving in Europe, but dying in Britain under Jeremy Corbyn
thread.title_full: The Left is evolving in Europe, but dying in Britain under Jeremy Corbyn

author: Asa Bennett
title: The Left is evolving in Europe, but dying in Britain under Jeremy Corbyn
text:
N ot so long ago, the Left was feeling ambitious. Ed Miliband dreamed of building a new Europe with Francois Hollande , who had just ended the presidency of his right-wing rival Nicholas Sarkozy. Together, they hoped to lead the continent into a new socialist world. But the electorate stepped in to nip that plan in the bud.
As sad as it must be for them to see their plans in tatters, they can console themselves with the knowledge that they're not the only socialists in Europe to fall upon hard times. The Left's collapse "everywhere" in Europe has left Conservative MEP Daniel Hannan feeling uneasy. "I just hope the Left gets its act together soon," he laments. "Someone needs to offer an opposition."
But Conservatives shouldn't try to read the Left its last rites just yet; it is alive and kicking in the heart of Europe. Germany's Social Democratic Party (SPD) is starting to pull ahead in the...
